TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
I've missed out on a lot of the Kliper progress and discussion due to school. It looks stellar. Can't wait to "fly" it back down to earth. Do you plan on creating a propulsion module for it that supports the Soyuz OM?

The IGLA when I get around to it, will be very similar design of LK dish, but without the star.

Ok, so, to recap on the dishes, we'll have the Kurs docking antenna, currently available, though with some stowage issues, the shiny-new LK "commie-star" dish, also currently available, and eventually a thicker, bulkier IGLA antenna like seen on Salyut?

Hi, I wanted to share my modest contribution to your topic Beale, I love your work, can't play anymore without tantares . Have a Salyut !

http://i.imgur.com/VujjbQo.png?1

http://i.imgur.com/LP3qVPf.png?1

http://i.imgur.com/0I3zBHo.png?1

I really like what spacecookie did to replicate the IGLA, but, those cubic octagonal struts aren't easy on my CPU.

Finally had some time to play ksp, i did a quick mission with the N1, and it is great!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I also had a bug with the landing legs, they fold back when timewarping... strange!
Goes hand in hand with the "Gemini" tool box that appears next to the capsule during time warp... perhaps they are both made with some sort of Chronaton alloy?

Decided to use the Tucana capsule to make a full-blown PPTS. Uses the heatshield from Polaris, Gemini RCS (plus extra linear thrusters in the nose protrusion, I'll probably adjust those so they thrust through CoM), tweakscaled (to 1.875m) Tantares service module, solar panels, and docking port, and the 2.5m decoupler from the Proton you made.

Also - I'm incredibly busy the coming week(s), so - yeah. I doubt much if anything new will get made (Though of course I can fix urgent bugs).

We know that you are not loafing around. Work hard so that you can earn that dough. We'll all root for you; it's the yeast we can do.
So all I found is that weird size bug has nothing to do with scale and rescaleFactor. Conducting in depth research tomorrow.

I've missed out on a lot of the Kliper progress and discussion due to school. It looks stellar. Can't wait to "fly" it back down to earth. Do you plan on creating a propulsion module for it that supports the Soyuz OM?

Ok, so, to recap on the dishes, we'll have the Kurs docking antenna, currently available, though with some stowage issues, the shiny-new LK "commie-star" dish, also currently available, and eventually a thicker, bulkier IGLA antenna like seen on Salyut?

I really like what spacecookie did to replicate the IGLA, but, those cubic octagonal struts aren't easy on my CPU.

Kliper: Yeah, the full set is to be made!

Dishes - Yeah, that's pretty much correct.

Finally had some time to play ksp, i did a quick mission with the N1, and it is great!

http://imgur.com/a/NS6CA

I also had a bug with the landing legs, they fold back when timewarping... strange!

So nice!

I think this is maybe the first N-1 mission there has been

LK bug - it's a known problem, since I've made the landing legs "dumb". When I have extra time, I'll try to fix this problem.

Goes hand in hand with the "Gemini" tool box that appears next to the capsule during time warp... perhaps they are both made with some sort of Chronaton alloy?

The "magic" properties of Tantares will hopefully not be around for long.

http://i.imgur.com/GZpJVvS.jpg

Decided to use the Tucana capsule to make a full-blown PPTS. Uses the heatshield from Polaris, Gemini RCS (plus extra linear thrusters in the nose protrusion, I'll probably adjust those so they thrust through CoM), tweakscaled (to 1.875m) Tantares service module, solar panels, and docking port, and the 2.5m decoupler from the Proton you made.

Very nice job you have done there!

This seems close to the final result!

We know that you are not loafing around. Work hard so that you can earn that dough. We'll all root for you; it's the yeast we can do.

Pun man, here is more loafing around...

Kliper Alpha Mk2

Warning: This includes flaps and is even less stable than the last download. But, the flaps should allow a better stable config in the end.

So all I found is that weird size bug has nothing to do with scale and rescaleFactor. Conducting in depth research tomorrow.

As I feared

I don't think this is a problem that can be fixed without scaling the base models.

Edited March 24, 2015 by Beale

So all I found is that weird size bug has nothing to do with scale and rescaleFactor. Conducting in depth research tomorrow.

I found a fix: set rescaleFactor = 1, then inside the MODEL brackets, add scale = 1.25, 1.25, 1.25. Finally, multiply all of the position values (x, y , z coordinates) for each node by 1.25.

It works for me.

Pun man, here is more loafing around...

Kliper Alpha Mk2

Warning: This includes flaps and is even less stable than the last download. But, the flaps should allow a better stable config in the end.

A toast for Beale.

its all getting a bit half-baked
